channel.title: Moderators
channel.description:
Why cant they delete topics?
They can only lock the spam that is getting posted...alot of it now..
And why can anyone post in the tutorial section now?
It used to be like pending or whatever, now people can post instantly.

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote="`Aaron, post:30, topic:333350"][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=429760.msg3155724#msg3155724 date=1269030297]
we don’t delete because we usually write messages in the locked topics. IDIOTS!
[/quote]

Sandy Vagina[/quote]
L O L!
Anyways from what i understand it is kept as proof if a user denies they posted w/e the mods locked. But why lock? just save a html copy on your webhost and delete from the forums.

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:28, topic:333350”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=429760.msg3157930#msg3157930 date=1269204571]

[quote author=the elve age link=topic=429760.msg3157906#msg3157906 date=1269203819]

Do mods also not delete and get rid of spam/flamed topics?

I never see anything being done about them
[/quote]That’s what this whole thread is about… =.=

They’re there for reference.

Meaning? I have reported spam/flame before, and nothing gets done.
[/quote]Reference, as in they’re there if you need them in the future. If the thread has information that could be useful in the future, it’s there.

I’m talking about POST themselves, not topics :P[/quote]The time it would take for moderators to sift through every single post in a thread would take a toll on the staffs’ job. There would be arguments on how someone’s post got removed but not others. There was already an example of this by relmitos and Jamie a while back. jme removed their complaints in the complaint thread and they got mad.

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“T3arful, post:21, topic:333350”][quote author=`Lewk_ link=topic=429760.msg3155884#msg3155884 date=1269037970]
I think after a topic is locked for a certain amount of time it automatically deletes.
[/quote]

They serve as a reference of what not to do.

Those funny things called ‘Rules’ are supposed to do that ;)[/quote]

It helps us to show an example of the full extent of the rule(s) and we may show back examples to users when they break that rule also. And being curious, how are rules “funny things”, they should be taken in a serious nature.

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

Stupit:

I have no idea what happened to the tutorial section, I mostly think because the moderators were to lazy to approve them.

I think that MITB is running SMF2.0 RC2 which means it is a fairly new release, however, there are currently not many mods that are compatible with it, The Post approval being one.

Also how dare you call Moderators lazy, I happen to know for a fact that they have a very difficult job moderating the posts and locking all of the stupid pointless threads…

I personally think it would be easier for a moderator to just lock a pointless tutorial than for them to have to approve or disprove, would probably be less work and less hassle for them. which in my opinion is a good thing as we wan’t to make our moderators enjoy being part of the community rather than having to be sorting out everybody’s spam all the while.

It is our responsibility to follow the rules the moderators should only be there to make sure they are followed and not to just lock threads that people are posting because they haven’t read the rules or because they cant be bothered to post in the correct section…

Thanks,
I’ve had my rant now…

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

ziplock:

They don’t delete topics because topics can be used as precedents.

Most of them aren’t even precedents anymore because almost every question in the help section has been asked more than once. I say purge the help section!

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

We don’t delete them because if someone say’s we abused we can just link back to that post and prove we didn’t. Also, it is nice to have forum’s with posts going back as far as we do.

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:13, topic:333350”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=429760.msg3155719#msg3155719 date=1269030012]

How about everything LOLBANNED ever posted?

Any particular reason ?
[/quote]

Yessir, all of his topics are leeched. We don’t support leeching so why not delete leeched topics?[/quote]His posts are examples for this forum.

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:9, topic:333350”][quote author=deathschaos9 link=topic=429760.msg3155706#msg3155706 date=1269029153]
How about everything LOLBANNED ever posted?
[/quote]

Any particular reason ?[/quote]

Yessir, all of his topics are leeched. We don’t support leeching so why not delete leeched topics?

Read full topic

item.title: Moderators
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

They’re used as examples. No matter if the question is asked twice or it’s repetitive, it just adds to the reasoning for using it again. For example, someone who posts something that has been posted once before can be excused. But someone who posts something that has been posted hundreds of times before can be denoted negatively. It’s a matter of exponential growth that goes throughout the community. I have no other way for explaining it besides the fact that it adds to the amount of threads that the forum has put out, making the number of threads themselves an example as well.

Read full topic
